comments.body: If you want, you can remove this paragraph or merge it into the previous one, since it shares a lot of substance with it.
Eventually, I decided to keep it as is. I think it's better to keep semantic from formatting separate, even in this case.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +49,53 @@run explicitly via `make lint-cpp`, does not currently catch a lot of rules that
are specific to the Node.js C++ code base. This document explains the most
common of these rules:

### Left-leaning (C++ style) asterisks for pointer declarations
